intro: Scleria filipendula, commonly known as the slender bulrush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. Scleria filipendula typically grows in wet or marshy habitats, such as swamps and riverbanks. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
